Message:
“Th-This is all just
one big misunderstanding!
I didn’t know that was
what they wanted—really!”

I had barely entered the tent
before the captive messenger girl
started prattling off
that frantic apology.

Apparently, the girl was of
the People of the Plains,
but from a tribe that was taken over
by the People of the Stone.

“I’m too weak, so I had no choice
but to obey their will!”—
or so she said.

The messenger was desperately
searching for any way to
make it out of her predicament alive.

The girl’s attempts to beg for her life
were truly a pathetic display to behold.

“Why do you resist?
The weak are destined to die.
It’s the law of nature.”

“‘Law of nature’...?
Do you really think that
just because humans are weaker,
any injustice against us is deserved?”

The girl’s demeanor
instantly changed.
Her cowardice
from earlier vanished,
an almost fiery defiance
flaring up in its place.

“Guess that ‘guardian deity’
shtick is just a name to you.
In the end, you’re no different
from those people in the city.”

“Don’t you dare lump me in
with those People of the Stone!
I’m...!”

What do they know...?!
This girl before me,
the People of the Stone,
the ones who took me in...!

Even though I’ve been
the one fending off
the People of the Stone’s
attacks this whole time...!

Why does no one
acknowledge me as a wolf...?!
